revised_title: Dynamical Capture of the Moon by the Earth: Early History and Capture Mechanisms
tldr: This article discusses the early history of the Moon and explores the possibility of its dynamical capture by the Earth. The authors investigate the process of capture through various mechanisms, including changes in solar eccentricity and lunar distances due to meteoritic bombardment. They also examine the role of tidal friction in altering the Moon's orbit and the importance of considering the angular momentum of incoming and outgoing meteoritic material.
